ratings.comment: Phil was a tough grader but good professor overall. He goes fast during lecture but the course is set up for you to use the lectures, discussions and homework to figure out the curriculum. Lots if homework but I would reccomend.

He's okay, he has a sense of humor but he goes really fast. There's multiple assignments every week. Tests are real tough, be ready to study weeks before. There's a curve which is nice, but the course was by far my hardest of the semester. He did not go at a pace that's beneficial for students, but rather for him and to get through the curriculum.

Highly recommend you stay away. He is very odd, a terrible grader and teacher, and has no desire to see you do well or learn. He is in no way understanding of his student's situations and should be avoided at all costs.

He was such a bad professor and was misleading about how the class was going to be curved. After a while I stopped going to lecture because I didn't learn anything from him. I had a solid TA but otherwise learned it on my own. I have no clue how phil wood is a professor at a university as good as UW Madison. If you take 211 choose another prof.

Philip grew on me throughout the semester. He has a really funny nerdy sarcastic sense of humor that came out throughout the semester. The class isn't easy and there's a ton of homework, but that isn't really his fault. Mini quiz every lecture so you have to go, but you wouldn't do well in the class if you didn't go. Good choice for prof
Best Professor I've met in math department ever. Professor Wood explained everything very well and made the complicated stuff easy to understand. Highly recommended.

This was a good class overall. He did a great job with martingales at the end. He also chose some interesting homework problems. Also set a very doable pace for the measure theory intro which I appreciated. I'd recommend him.
This guy is not a very good teacher. Unfortunately, many of you will have to take this class.

He is a very helpful teacher.  The class is a difficult class but if you put in studying you can easily receive a B.  Class is required to attend so do not take this class if you do not want to attend class.  Out of the 211 teachers take Prof. Wood.
Wood is a helpful professor and makes a demanding class easier since he wants the students to do well. Put in some hours per week plus study really hard for exams and you will get an A!

He is a really nice guy that wants you to do well in his class.  The class is a lot of work with 5 quizzes a week but they help your grade and help you study.  I would definitely take this class with this professor.

Professor Wood's 211 Calculus course is very demanding. There are two quizzes per lecture and one discussion quiz per week. This means attendance is vital to your grade. He teaches and speaks at a very fast pace, sometimes going into his own world during lecture. Nonetheless, he is very willing to help you during his office hours. Study 7+hours/wk.

Homework every week was very difficult and it was nearly impossible to finish in a reasonable amount of time, 5+ hours for an acceptable grade. The exams are do-able but simply because the homework is significantly more difficult. Overall, if you take this class, you must put the time required in just to pass.

He taught word-for-word out of the book's explanation, which was all right.  However, the book problems were nigh impossible and he didn't really teach any helpful material outside of saying the book's words verbatim.
